message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.DL, cs.DB, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses the efficient transfer of large datasets in distributed environments, which is a common problem in the field of Distributed Computing (cs.DC). The use of network and disk load variations to predict transfer times suggests a focus on Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI). The use of regression techniques to make predictions is a common approach in Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Data Mining (cs.DM), but the focus on large data transfers suggests a closer fit with the Data Management (cs.DB) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of end-to-end application throughput observations to capture whole-system performance, which suggests a focus on Systems and Control (cs.SY). Overall, the most likely sub-category is cs.DC, followed by cs.NI, cs.DB, cs.SY, and cs.DM.
